metadata.title: USN-6719-1 -- util-linux vulnerability
metadata.description: Skyler Ferrante discovered that the util-linux wall command did not filter escape sequences from command line arguments. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6719-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  bsdutils - 1:2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 No subscription required  bsdextrautils - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 eject - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 fdisk - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 libblkid-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 libblkid1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 libfdisk-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 libfdisk1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 libmount-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 libmount1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 libsmartcols-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 libsmartcols1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 libuuid1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 mount - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 rfkill - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 util-linux - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 util-linux-locales - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 uuid-dev - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 uuid-runtime - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3 No subscription required
